definitions: Cooked (an egg) without its shell in or over boiling water.
Cooked (food, especially fish or chicken) gently in a small amount of simmering liquid.
Illegally hunted or caught (game or fish) on another's land or without permission.
Taken or appropriated (something) unfairly or illicitly.
examples: She enjoyed her poached egg on toast.
The chef poached the salmon to perfection.
The deer was poached from the private estate.
